PageTitle: display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface
FuncDef:
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes command displays BGP routes sent to unnumbered BGP peers.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface received-routes command displays BGP routes received from unnumbered peers.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and match a route-policy.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface not-accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and fail to match a route-policy. The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes command displays BGP routes sent to unnumbered BGP peers. The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface received-routes command displays BGP routes received from unnumbered peers. The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and match a route-policy. The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface not-accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and fail to match a route-policy.
CLIs: display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } advertised-routes
display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } advertised-routes <ipv4-address> [ { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> } [ longer-prefixes ] ]
display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } received-routes [ active ]
display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } received-routes <ipv4-address> [ { <mask-length> | <mask-ipv4> } [ original-attributes ] ]
display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } { accepted-routes | not-accepted-routes }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies the number of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates the routes sent to the peer.
-

Specifies an IPv4 network segment address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a mask length of an IP address.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask of the IPv4 network segment.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Indicates the route from the peer.
-

Displays active routes from the peer.
-

Indicates the routes that match the policy.
-

Indicates the routes that do not match the policy.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface 100GE 1/0/1 received-routes
Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, a - add path,
ExtraInfo:
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes command displays BGP routes sent to unnumbered BGP peers.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface received-routes command displays BGP routes received from unnumbered peers.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and match a route-policy.
The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface not-accepted-routes command displays BGP routes that are received from unnumbered BGP peers and fail to match a route-policy.
